api Package¶

ssh_key Module¶

ansible_api.api.ssh_key.check_user_ssh_key(username, inventory, vinz_private_key_path)¶

Checks a list of remote machines for a user’s authorized_keys file.

Parameters:
  • username – The username of the user on the remote machines
  • inventory – A list of servers to check
  • vinz_private_key_path – The path to the private key needed to access the remote machines
Returns:

A dictionary mapping servers to lists of keys from the authorized_keys file
{
“server1.example.com”: [‘asdfasdfasdfadsf’, ‘adsfasdfasasdfa’], “server2.example.com”: [‘asdfasdfasdfadsf’, ‘adsfasdfasasdfa’], “server3.example.com”: [‘asdfasdfasdfadsf’, ‘adsfasdfasasdfa’],

}

ansible_api.api.ssh_key.remove_user_ssh_key(username, inventory, user_public_key, vinz_private_key_path)¶
Parameters:
  • username – The username of the user on the remote machines
  • inventory – A list of servers to remove the user’s public ssh key from
  • user_public_key – The key to remove
  • vinz_private_key_path – The path to the private key needed to access the remote machines
ansible_api.api.ssh_key.set_user_ssh_key(username, inventory, user_public_key, vinz_private_key_path)¶
Parameters:
  • username – The username of the user on the remote machines
  • inventory – A list of servers to add the public key to
  • user_public_key – A string represnetation of the user’s public key
  • vinz_private_key_path – The path to the private key needed to access the remote machines

user Module¶

ansible_api.api.user.add_user(username, inventory, vinz_private_key_path)¶
Parameters:
  • username – The username of the user to be added to the remote machines
  • inventory – A list of servers to add the user to
  • vinz_private_key_path – The path to the private key needed to access the remote machines
ansible_api.api.user.remove_user(username, inventory, vinz_private_key_path)¶
Parameters:
  • username – The username of the user to be removed from the remote machines
  • inventory – A list of servers to remove the user from
  • vinz_private_key_path – The path to the private key needed to access the remote machines
